content:
# The smelting process has successfully produced 5 additional iron plates in the furnace.
# Now, I need to extract those iron plates to increase my total count of iron plates in the inventory.
# After smelting, my inventory currently consists of:
# - 5 stone
# - 5 iron ore
# - 5 copper ore
# - 7 iron plates (before extraction)
# - 10 iron gear wheels
# - 10 electronic circuits

# I'll extract the 5 iron plates from the furnace.
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace, quantity=5)  # Extracting the iron plates

# Now I will check my inventory after extracting the iron plates.
print(f"Inventory after extracting iron plates: {inspect_inventory()}")

# After extraction, my total of iron plates should now be 12.
# I will now verify if I have enough materials to craft the assembling machine:
# - 10 iron gear wheels (I have 10)
# - 10 iron plates (I now have 12)
# - 5 wood (I have 2, so I need to gather more).
# - 10 electronic circuits (I have 10)

# I currently have enough iron gears and plates, but I need to gather more wood to reach the required amount of 5.

# Let's gather more wood from the nearest source.
wood_position = nearest(Resource.Wood)
move_to(wood_position)  # Moving to the wood position
harvest_resource(wood_position, quantity=5)  # Gathering more wood
print(f"Inventory after gathering more wood: {inspect_inventory()}") 

# Now I will check if I have enough wood to craft the assembling machine.
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.Wood, 0) >= 5, "Not enough wood to craft the assembling machine."

# Now that I have all the needed resources, I can finally craft the assembling machine!
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1)  # Crafting the assembling machine

# Checking inventory after crafting the assembling machine
print(f"Inventory after crafting the assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
